It doesn't matter if you're a long-standing admirer of Armando Iannucci's work or you jumped on board after Veep. Anyone who appreciates him will know, even before seeing the movie, that there exists a contingent of critics concerned with its historical accuracy. Regardless of credentials, many of them are paid to watch, in this case, a farce. And all the ones who question its accuracy and try to guess a motive have no business critiquing films.
